title: Fix prefix extraction for multi-hyphen prefixes with hash IDs
description:
Fixed bug where issue IDs with multiple hyphens in the prefix and hash suffixes were incorrectly parsed. For example, 'web-app-a3f8e9' was being parsed as prefix 'web-' instead of 'web-app'.

The root cause was in ExtractIssuePrefix() which only checked for numeric suffixes. When it encountered a hash suffix (like 'a3f8e9'), it would fall back to using the first hyphen instead of the last hyphen.

The fix adds hash detection logic via isLikelyHash() which checks if a suffix looks like a hexadecimal hash (4-8 characters, all hex digits). This allows the function to correctly handle both numeric and hash suffixes.

Test cases added for:
- web-app-123 (numeric suffix)
- web-app-a3f8e9 (hash suffix)  
- my-cool-app-a3f8e9 (three-part prefix with hash)
- super-long-project-name-1a2b (four-part prefix with hash)
- Various hash lengths (4-6 chars)
- Uppercase and mixed-case hashes

Files modified:
- internal/utils/issue_id.go: Added isLikelyHash() and updated ExtractIssuePrefix()
- internal/utils/id_parser_test.go: Added comprehensive test cases

This fix enables beads to work correctly with projects that have hyphens in their names.
